data.title: Secular triumph as British government bans creationism from free schools and academies
Australia now has a chance to get rid of Tony Abbott, as the Greens and Labor have triggered the possibility of a double dissolution election.
Baghdad has formally called on the United States to launch air strikes against jihadist militants
Elon Musk: Forget NASA and 2035. I'll put HUMANS on MARS by 2026
Julian Assange has asked the US Attorney General Eric Holder to respect the principles of free speech and dissolve the Grand Jury investigation into Wikileaks, or resign.
Japan makes possession of child pornography a punishable offense
North Korea's glorious leader is seen showing off the crown jewel of his navy: a Russian war submarine that has been obsolete since 1961
ISIS begins assault on Baghdad: Gunmen attack North of Iraqi Capital
Saudis give apparent warning to Iran: don't meddle in Iraq
Australian PM Tony Abbott makes Australia the first developed nation to ask UNESCO to delist heritage for his Great Barrier Reef dredge-and-dump plan
